file_content.text: Talk to Darmas. Let's show Rogun what happens to people who mess with us.
I owe you again, Captain. Though I'm not sure whether to be grateful or blame you for bringing this trouble down in the first place.
So, Captain, are you the bad luck that keeps getting me attacked, or the lucky charm who keeps rescuing me?
What are those things? Have you ever seen an animal like this?
I've seen a lot of weird stuff, but those I would remember.
Nope.
The beast looks modified, but I can't make heads or tails of the original form.
They look cybernetic.
Well, I'll pay good money to find out what they are.
Long as they die when you shoot them, doesn't matter what they are.
Who cares?
If they turn up on a Republic shuttle pad trying to eat me, I've got a vested interest in figuring out where they come from.
And how Rogun the Butcher got his hands on them.
He's just managed to move himself from thorn-in-my-side to Public Enemy Number One.
So, what's the plan? Send a strike team? Sic the SIS on him?
Now you're talking.
Why would I want to do that when I have you?
If you need someone to bring you Rogun's head on a plate, look no further.
You want me to take him down?
What a lovely offer. Most men stick to boring old flowers and jewels.
Oh, I couldn't accept such a gift. You keep it.
Rogun is the Voidwolf's most dangerous tool.
What about the Voidwolf?
There's worse out there.
The Voidwolf is beyond our power to deal with. He's the most powerful non-Sith military leader in the Empire.
But Rogun is one of his most dangerous tools.
I think the time has come to take down his criminal empire once and for all.
And I thought going legit meant I wouldn't have any fun....
Sold!
Just don't let your maniacal giggling make you lose sight of how dangerous he is.
Can you steeple your fingers and say, "together we can rule the world..."?
[Flirt] Scheming suits you.
Stick with me, love, and you don't need to stop at one world.
Love? Did she just say "love"?
Are you done here?
Perhaps we should take some time and "strategize." Alone.
What, are you ashamed of me?
[Flirt] Alone?
A Senator and some scruffy pirate?
And a Twi'lek at that....
You have to admit it'll draw some looks.
Are you so eager to show me off?
If you're doing this to make me jealous, stop. I don't play these sorts of games.
I don't care if you're the Supreme blasted Chancellor. Back off!
You need to get your pets leashed, love. This one looks like she bites.
She's got no claim on me.
[Flirt] Forget her.
Once you've run free with the wolves, you can never be a lapdog.
This is who I am, Risha.
Fine! Just don't expect to find me waiting when you're done!
Don't try to tie me down.
This is who I am, Akaavi.
You do what you need to. Just expect me to do the same.
Another time and place... things would be different.
Sorry, I'm taken.
Just don't expect that time and place to happen again.
I have a room just off the shuttlebay....
Just make sure you get your shots.
I will get out of your way.
A Senator, Captain? Be careful this doesn't end like the rest of them....
I'll be at the ship.
Oh, I guess that was my cue to leave, huh?
Let's go.
Don't say anything, Captain. I've got no interest in awkward pillow talk.
Go to Darmas on Port Nowhere, find out anything he knows about Rogun's business, and those... things that attacked me.
I'm sure I'll be seeing you again soon.
My heart belongs to Risha.
Sorry, I'm taken.
Too bad that's the least used part of you.
Believe me, I don't want to get Akaavi mad at me.
I'm taken.
You're sweet.
Well, your loyalty is commendable. Even if your tastes are... eclectic.
As long as you're holding the purse strings, it's better that we don't.
Sorry. Conflict of interests.
Gotten burned before, huh?
I'm surprised you don't see the scars.
You can't imagine some of the girls he's gone with....
Ha.
It's best not to mix business and pleasure.
The Jedi had a saying about that. "Never trade love for money." Or was it "money for love"? Actually, part of it was about wisdom....
I'm, ah, spread a little thin as it is.
Maybe another time.
Running out of stamina, Captain? That hardly jibes with your reputation.
Maybe once I've taken out Rogun.
Not interested.
You don't have to let me down easy, Captain. I can tell when you're not interested.
Do you have a plan?
Aren't there more important targets than Rogun?
What about the war?
Attacking Rogun is attacking the Voidwolf.
Find out anything Darmas knows about Rogun's businesses. And where he might have gotten those... things that attacked me.
Then we can figure out how to best work this plan into the larger war effort.
Hands off the Senator!
Captain! I thought you were dead. The ship... I saw it explode....
I thought you was dead, too. Rogun's gonna be real happy I didn't get here too late.
The rest of you, sic the ssorokks on the lady. I'm taking this one on personal.
If you're going to hit that ship, do it before it leaves orbit.
Surprised to see me? Who do you think pulled the strings to let you use this shuttle pad?
Believe me, most Republic naval officers don't like sharing their secrets with "some rogue spacer whose only loyalty is to credits."
Personally, I've always felt loyalty is overrated.
Is that supposed to make me feel better?
That's not inspiring.
I didn't realize you had such delicate sensibilities.
I told them that just makes you sound more dashing.
You came all the way to Nar Shaddaa just to help me?
Why are you here?
Of course not. I'm coordinating recruitment of local support on Nar Shaddaa to finally drive the Imperials off.
Oh? You've got a thing for bad boys?
[Flirt] I am dashing.
I don't know about boys, but there's some bad men I just can't get enough of.
If you're asking for a grown-up, you're at the wrong ship.
Where's the shuttle?
I'm not here to chat.
Don't worry. I won't hold you up.
Darmas told me what you're doing. It's quite heroic, really.
The Treaty of Coruscant forbids official strikes on non-military vessels. We're lucky you're not bound by that.
I'd hate to have to share the spoils with a whole squadron.
More money for me.
And I'm sure they're thrilled not to share the risk with you.
Happy to help.
If you think this is so important, quit slowing me down.
Out of my way.
Just a warning, then. The Empire is moving reinforcements into the area.
Be careful.
I'd hate to see that handsome face blown into space debris.
The shuttle pad's right over there.
So, what's the report, Captain? I have to say, I was expecting better results from you.
What happened to the White Maw's cloaking technology?
Let's just say it involved a beautiful slave girl, a backward child and a Weequay with a trapdoor fetish.
You wouldn't believe me.
I'm not even going to ask.
Soon you'll be hearing about my pirate fleet being the one no sensor can detect.
It's mine now.
Your arrogance amazes me, Captain. It's one thing to steal from the Republic. It's another to admit it to my face.
There was an unfortunate blaster misfire. The tech didn't make it.
[Lie] It was destroyed.
I can't say I'm not disappointed, but your successes on Balmorra more than make up for it.
This arrangement seems to be serving you far better than it's served me.
Excellent work, Captain. Though, I'm not sure the Military Ops Committee will believe the outcome.
Personally, I find it a bit terrifying that something so important can rest with a single individual.
I find it absolutely amazing how much money the Republic will spend for that individual. Right?
As long as I get paid.
The funds are already in your account. The Republic takes care of its successes.
Alilia and the boy have been hurt enough. I promised them the Republic would be different.
Just take care of them.
It's cute how quickly you get attached. One of the reasons we picked you.
That's what it always comes down to.
Everything does.
What now?
I've been called back to Coruscant, so I won't have anything new for you for a bit. Sit back and enjoy the fruits of what you've done.
What's our next move, beautiful?
[Flirt] What now?
Oh, I give up.
You really have no idea of boundaries, do you?
You throw that word around very freely.
For you and me? Nothing I want to discuss in such a public setting.
Incoming call, Captain. That Darmas is on the other line.
Come look me up any time.
The Republic thanks you for your service.
